alert.note: Alert for Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Extreme Wind Warning issued August 30 at 8:03AM EDT until August 30 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Extreme Wind Warning for... Suwannee County in northern Florida... * Until 1000 AM EDT. * At 803 AM EDT, National Weather Service Doppler radar indicated extreme winds, associated with the eyewall of Hurricane Idalia, were moving onshore along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Dowling Park to 8 miles southwest of Obrien, moving north at 55 mph. THIS IS AN EXTREMELY DANGEROUS AND LIFE-THREATENING SITUATION! * Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Suwannee Springs, Wellborn, Dowling Park, Obrien, Mcalpin, Luraville, Newburn, and Houston. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for northern Florida.
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Treat these imminent extreme winds as if a tornado was approaching and move immediately to the safe room in your shelter. Take action now to protect your life!
